files.README.md:
üêß Welcome to Debian GNU/Linux on WebTerm!

‚ú® Features:
- Rock-solid stability
- APT package management
- Universal Operating System
- Strong commitment to free software
- Extensive hardware support

üìö Getting Started:
- Type 'help' to see all available commands
- Type 'apt-cache search' to search packages
- Type 'dpkg -l' to list installed packages
- Type 'debian-version' for system info

üé® This is a simulation of Debian 12 (Bookworm).
Experience the universal operating system!

üí° Pro tip: Try 'neofetch' to see your Debian system info!
files.notes.txt:
üìù Debian User Notes:

üéØ Todo:
- Update package lists with 'sudo apt update'
- Upgrade system with 'sudo apt upgrade'
- Review installed packages
- Check system stability metrics

üí≠ Debian Features:
- Legendary stability
- Rigorous testing process
- Strong focus on free software
- Large package repository
- Multiple architectures support
- Conservative release cycle

üöÄ Completed:
‚úÖ Debian stable installation
‚úÖ WebTerm configuration
‚úÖ Package management familiarity
files..bashrc:
# ~/.bashrc: executed by bash(1) for non-login shells.
# see /usr/share/doc/bash/examples/startup-files (in the package bash-doc)
# for examples

# If not running interactively, don't do anything
case $- in
    *i*) ;;
      *) return;;
esac

# don't put duplicate lines or lines starting with space in the history.
HISTCONTROL=ignoreboth

# append to the history file, don't overwrite it
shopt -s histappend

# for setting history length see HISTSIZE and HISTFILESIZE in bash(1)
HISTSIZE=1000
HISTFILESIZE=2000

# check the window size after each command and, if necessary,
# update the values of LINES and COLUMNS.
shopt -s checkwinsize

# Debian aliases
alias ll='ls -alF'
alias la='ls -A'
alias l='ls -CF'

# Add an "alert" alias for long running commands.  Use like so:
#   sleep 10; alert
alias alert='notify-send --urgency=low -i "$([ $? = 0 ] && echo terminal || echo error)" "$(history|tail -n1|sed -e '\''s/^\s*[0-9]\+\s*//;s/[;&|]\s*alert$//'\'')"'

# enable programmable completion features (you don't need to enable
# this, if it's already enabled in /etc/bash.bashrc and /etc/profile
# sources /etc/bash.bashrc).
if ! shopt -oq posix; then
  if [ -f /usr/share/bash-completion/bash_completion ]; then
    . /usr/share/bash-completion/bash_completion
  elif [ -f /etc/bash_completion ]; then
    . /etc/bash_completion
  fi
fi
files.debian-reference.txt:
üîí Important Debian Information:

üìã System Details:
- Distribution: Debian GNU/Linux 12 (Bookworm)
- Kernel: Linux 6.1.0-10-amd64
- Init System: systemd
- Package Manager: APT + dpkg
- Desktop: Multiple options (GNOME, KDE, Xfce, etc.)

üõ†Ô∏è Key Commands:
- sudo apt update && sudo apt upgrade
- apt-cache search package-name
- dpkg -l | grep package
- systemctl status service-name
- update-alternatives --config editor

üì¶ Package Sources:
- Main: DFSG-compliant packages
- Contrib: DFSG-compliant, dependencies may not be
- Non-free: Not DFSG-compliant

üåê Resources:
- Debian Official: https://www.debian.org
- Documentation: https://www.debian.org/doc/
- Package Search: https://packages.debian.org

motd: ‚ú® Features: Stability | APT | Free Software | Universal OS
üí° Type 'help' for available commands | 'theme' to toggle themes
üéØ Try: apt-cache search, dpkg -l, debian-version, neofetch

help.description: Shows a list of available commands with descriptions

ls.description: Lists files and directories in the current location

pwd.description: Prints the current working directory path

uname -a.output: Linux debian-stable 6.1.0-10-amd64 #1 SMP PREEMPT_DYNAMIC Debian 6.1.38-4 (2023-08-08) x86_64 GNU/Linux

uptime.description: Shows how long the system has been running
uptime.output: up 5 days, 12 hours, 30 minutes, 1 user, load average: 0.08, 0.12, 0.15

neofetch.description: Displays a colorful system information screen

debian-version.output:
